primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus interrupts the human cycle of scarcity and fear by enacting a new reality of divine abundance.

tekstueel_bewijs: all that is needed for an abundant life
overflow of God’s generosity that floods creation
given to every creature without limit
the voice of fear says there is not enough
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Scarcity is presented as a 'world' or 'reality' that holds the imagination captive, requiring a divine interruption to break.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church (Philip/Andrew) attempting to solve the problem of hunger through calculation.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church (Philip/Andrew/Hearer)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (human effort) fails and is 'interrupted' by the primary program (Jesus' action).

voorbeelden_god_subject: He fulfills the desire of all who fear him.
Jesus takes the narrative in a quite fresh direction.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I work and calculate and count.
Philip is thinking in old-world categories.

voorbeelden: we had better send the fleet
He wanted to see whether Philip understood.
He knows there will be more than enough!
Jesus already knows about his own capacity

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' of Jesus to create a new reality, contrasting it with the 'Incompetence' (lack of Savoir and Pouvoir) of the disciples.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts in S2 (Fear), moves to ~S1 (Calculation), is interrupted by S1 (Abundance), resulting in ~S2 (Surplus).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Interruption' of Jesus, who invalidates the logic of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; scarcity is described as a haunting, deep-seated reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is strongly theocentric. Jesus is the primary actor who does what humans cannot. The 'interruption' motif ensures grace is seen as an external in-breaking rather than a human development.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I work and calculate and count ... just another effort

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: That antiphon has been interrupted by none other than Jesus.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The biblical figures (Philip/Andrew) are used as negative examples of incompetence, not models to follow.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Jesus acts where the disciples fail.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and shift in perspective from anxiety to wonder.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic: Salvation/Abundance is a work of God alone.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'antiphon' of the Psalm to the narrative of John 6 is seamless and structurally sound.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'already' of the surplus and the 'still haunted' reality of the hearer.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus enacts a new world... invalidates our old world.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on Christological enactment rather than Pneumatological indwelling.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is viewed as a 'grip' or 'mantra' of scarcity/anxiety that humans cannot break themselves.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by Jesus as Subject. The human actants are correctly positioned as incompetent receivers.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the current identification with the 'hungry crowd' rather than the 'calculating disciples'.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong emphasis on Pouvoir (Power) and Savoir (Knowledge).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Slightly more emphasis on the 'Vouloir' (the transformation of the hearer's desire).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explore how the 'interruption' changes what the hearer *wants* to do, not just what they see.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Scarcity is well-defined but largely psychological/economic.
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Link scarcity more explicitly to the 'Opponent' of Death.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To show that the 'bread' is not just for stomachs but for the life of the world against the grave.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The current structure (Soteriology → Ethics as 'Oddness') is excellent.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented preaching. By making Jesus the Subject of the 'interruption,' you avoid the trap of turning the feeding of the 5,000 into a lesson on human sharing.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'antiphon' metaphor, semiotics reveals that the metaphor functions as a 'Heavy Opponent' (Scarcity) that only a 'New Subject' (Jesus) can defeat.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the Greek 'eucharisto'; semiotics focuses on how that 'thanks' functions as a 'Helper' in the transition from lack to surplus.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas helps us see that the 'Church' (Philip/Andrew) is structurally an 'Opponent' or 'Failed Subject' until Jesus takes over the narrative program.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (enacts, takes, gives, distributed, knows, is not held back)
God (satisfies, fulfills, hears, saves, watches, overwhelms)
The Church/Philip (does not get it, is trapped, calculates)
appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids 'Exemplarism' by portraying the disciples as failures, thereby highlighting Christ's sufficiency.
